intro: Rumex acetosa subsp. montanus, commonly known as mountain sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, often in well-drained soils. The plant features upright stems with alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces oval, smooth seeds. It is valued for its sour-tasting leaves, which have been used in traditional cuisine and medicine.
